cards.title: Bare Feet
cards.text: Bare Feet airs on PBS stations nationwide, the PBS Passport App, and the Described and Captioned Media Program (DCMP).

cards.title: Canal 22 Internacional
cards.text: DirecTV (CH 446), AT&T (CH 3022), Spectrum (CH 841), Grande (CH 205), Wave (CH 518), Verizon (CH 1646).

cards.title: Canal Trece
cards.text: Canal Trece selected educational programming is available on YouTube and the Described and Captioned Media Program (DCMP).

cards.title: Crawford Entertainment
cards.text: Watch the series at the Discover Florida Channel, Roku, Apple TV, Amazon Fire TV, and the Discover Florida Channel app available for iOS and Android. It is also available at the Described and Captioned Media Program (DCMP).

cards.title: Fred Rogers
cards.text: Fred Rogers Productions builds on the legacy of Fred Rogers by creating quality children’s media that models an enthusiasm for learning and earns the trust of parents and caregivers. Its series are streamed on PBS Kids, Amazon Prime Video, Hoopla, and DirecTV. You can also buy it as a download on Apple TV, Amazon Video, Google Play Movies, and Vudu.

cards.title: HITN
cards.text: DIRECTV, DIRECTV NOW, DISH Network, AT&T U-verse TV, Verizon FiOS TV, Comcast, Charter Spectrum, Mediacom, CenturyLink Prism and Altice. Check the guide for all the channels according to geographic location.

cards.title: I Am Peace
cards.text: The I am Peace Festival promoted actions related to the construction of Culture(s) of Peace in accordance with the UNResolution A - 53/243. The films shown during the festival are available at the Described and Captioned Media Program (DCMP).

cards.title: Independent Producers
cards.text: The productions by Taylor Aguilar, Teregua, and Tatiana Millan are available in the Described and Captioned Media Program (DCMP).

cards.title: KET
cards.text: Kentucky Educational Television — KET — is Kentucky’s largest classroom, serving more than one million people each week via television, online, and mobile. It is an innovative and efficient producer of digital education tools for the classroom and Kentucky’s highest-quality source for public affairs and cultural programming. Watch KET programs at KET.org, the PBS App (available for iOS and Android mobile devices and home devices, including Samsung and Android Smart TVs, Apple TV, and Roku), and the KET App (available for iOS and Android mobile devices).

cards.title: New Day Films
cards.text: Films by New Day Films are available on New Day's streaming platform and Kanopy, an on-demand streaming video platform for public libraries and universities.

cards.title: Passport To Knowledge
cards.text: Searching airs on PBS stations nationwide. It is also available on the series' website, YouTube, and the Described and Captioned Media Program (DCMP).

cards.title: POV
cards.text: POV films are broadcast by PBS stations around the country. Tune in on Mondays at 10 pm (check your local listings). You can stream POV films anytime, anywhere on all PBS-branded platforms, including pbs.org and the PBS Video app. The PBS App is available on iOS, Android, Apple TV, and Roku streaming devices.

cards.title: Pragda
cards.text: Pragda is a film distributor for the newest Latin American, Spanish, and Latinx cinema. Its content is available on educational streaming platforms such as Kanopy and Alexander Street Press.

cards.title: Semillitas
cards.text: Semillitas is a TV channel that offers entertainment for young children aged 0-6. The channel's programming is tailored to different age groups throughout the day. Between 6 am and 11 am, the programming is designed for children up to 3 years old, while the rest of the day is directed at kids aged 3-6. All the programs are animated series and are distributed without advertisements. Semillitas is available on Charter Spectrum channel 922, Verizon channel 1721 (HD), Commzoom channel 234, RCN channel 835, Hargray channel 301, and Ziply Fiber channel 1723.

cards.title: Sesame Workshop
cards.text: Sesame Workshop is the nonprofit organization behind legendary children’s shows such as Sesame Street, which reaches close to 12 Million Kids in the U.S. each month. Watch Sesame's content with audio description in Spanish on Plaza Sesamo YouTube's channel.

cards.title: SUPERFEST
cards.text: Superfest Disability Film Festival is the longest running disability film festival in the world. Since it first debuted in a small Los Angeles showcase in 1970 it has become an eagerly anticipated international event—hosted by Paul K. Longmore Institute on Disability at San Francisco State. For more than 30 years, Superfest has celebrated cutting-edge cinema that portrays disability through a diverse, complex, unabashed and engaging lens. Superfest is one of the few festivals worldwide that prioritizes access for disabled filmgoers of all kinds.

cards.title: WaterBear
cards.text: WaterBear is an ad-free, interactive streaming platform focused on environmental sustainability, offering award-winning documentaries, short films, and series while connecting viewers with over 100 NGO partners to support planet-saving missions. Watch WaterBear content directly on its free subscription platform.

cards.title: WIPR
cards.text: WIPR is a TV station owned and run by the Puerto Rico Public Broadcasting Corporation. It has been producing educational and cultural TV programming since 1958. Watch its programs on Puerto Rico public TV and the WIPR App for iOS and Android.
